pageContext.description: Cutting end of socketed celt. Well cast but core off centre. Shows marks of coarse lime. Cutting edge damaged. Suggests never was work hardened to the point where it flaked in use.
pageContext.patina: Deep brown. Has mottled green incrustation; very light.
pageContext.surface: Slight traces of blow in casting. Green mottle as from fabric or leather.
pageContext.associations: Other hoards found same area and time. See Brit Mus. "Addington, 'Kent'" (sic.)
pageContext.collection: Formerly Given to "Peter" Mills (1914) Now held by Croydon Public Library in effects of [lore?] "Peter" Mills.),British Museum, 1960.5-4.1
pageContext.site: England,Greater London (Surrey),Croydon,Shirley,Addington Golf Course,Found "in Addington Park between the Swiss Lodge and the Gold House along Shirley (Church) Rd.",During construction of the Golf course, 1914.
pageContext.toSearch: 176-178 Shirley Church Road, Croydon, Greater London CR0, UK
